ssh.description: A protocol for secure remote access to network devices.

Netconf.description: It is a network monitoring protocol which configure network devices like routers, switches programatically. It removes configuration complexity, vendor specific commands and have better efficiency which is generally found in SNMP. </br> Data representation: XML </br> Protocol used: SSH </br> Alternative : RestConf
Netconf.features:
Device configuration management(CRUD of devices)
Transactional changes(support commit and rollback)
standaridized and strctured with YAng model
commands: get - Retrieve operational data e.g., interface status.
commit - Apply candidate configuration to the running state.
lock and unlock - Prevent concurrent edits during a session.
delete-config - Delete a specified data store (e.g., candidate).
benefits: Automation-Ready(SDN and automation tool like ansible etc)
disadvantages: Performance overhead (XML And SSH compare to json and Rest features)
Scalability(separate SSH connection for each ssh connection, which limits how many simultaneous sessions a server can manage.)
